column4: can soemone help me with installing Openoffice.org, I am getting md5sum errors. http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/22348
are you downloading via apt-get or the website?
I also attempted to install through teh add/remove programs
do you have the us.archive.com/ubuntu?  if so, get rid of the us in front of it, the stuff from those servers are fubared
looks liek the cd is possibly corrupt, even though I recently did a fresh install off it
you know you can change where it downloads the packages from by editing your /etc/apt/sources.list
comment out the cd, thats what the repos are for
you can also search repo at wiki.ubuntu.com
thanks at least the actual install is starting now. lets hope it finishes
are you installing from the cd or just adding the office stuff?
I commented out the cd in the sources list and I removed the us. in the us.archive/ubuntu
also, uncomment all the other repos there and take out all the us's
that allows for adding of more stuff
I removed all the US's, but didn't comment out anything but the cd's what else should I be commenting out?
no, uncomment the rest of those other repos and remove the #
oh, gotcha, I already did that. and thanks again, OpenOffice is installed now
